update.description:
pull request #2021 added the new joint creation dialog. This PR extends it to support creating joints with links in nested models (e.g. all models inserted from the model database list in the Insert tab in model editor are nested models)

video:

https://www.dropbox.com/s/11q5p169nl4nfu8/nested_model_joint.ogv?dl=0

[jenkins homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/33/) - ok

content.raw:
it's related to the `TODO` note in [SchematicView.cc:123](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f29d56b3a959f6c2757059433074e4a5f93363cf/gazebo/gui/model/SchematicViewWidget.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#SchematicViewWidget.cc-123). 

I just removed it and reverted the to the old behavior where nested model links are displayed as individual boxes in the schematic view. It's something to be fixed but hopefully that's less confusing than before.
content.html:
it's related to the TODO note in SchematicView.cc:123.

I just removed it and reverted the to the old behavior where nested model links are displayed as individual boxes in the schematic view. It's something to be fixed but hopefully that's less confusing than before.

pull_request.title: Support joint creation between nested model links in model editor

pullrequest.title: Support joint creation between nested model links in model editor

content.raw:
Just to be clear, a way to reproduce the issue is:

1. Insert 2 pendulums

2. Make a joint from one pendulum to the other

3. Use the align tool, the link will detach from the model.

4. Save - the saved model has the link in its original pose
content.html:
Just to be clear, a way to reproduce the issue is:

  1. Insert 2 pendulums

  2. Make a joint from one pendulum to the other

  3. Use the align tool, the link will detach from the model.

  4. Save - the saved model has the link in its original pose

pull_request.title: Support joint creation between nested model links in model editor

pullrequest.title: Support joint creation between nested model links in model editor

content.raw:
The align tool in the creation dialog breaks nested models apart, but when saved, the model maintains its original kinematics.

Supporting this might require a lot of changes, not sure what the best solution would be for now. Disable alignment and relative pose on the creation dialog if one of the links is in a nested model?
content.html:
The align tool in the creation dialog breaks nested models apart, but when saved, the model maintains its original kinematics.

Supporting this might require a lot of changes, not sure what the best solution would be for now. Disable alignment and relative pose on the creation dialog if one of the links is in a nested model?

pull_request.title: Support joint creation between nested model links in model editor

pullrequest.title: Support joint creation between nested model links in model editor

content.raw:
1. Insert some links and nested models and make a joint between links

1. Open the joint inspector

1. Change the child to another link, the visual moves

1. Change the child to a nested model, the visual moves

1. Change back to another link - the visual stays in the nested model
content.html:
1. Insert some links and nested models and make a joint between links

  2. Open the joint inspector

  3. Change the child to another link, the visual moves

  4. Change the child to a nested model, the visual moves

  5. Change back to another link - the visual stays in the nested model
